[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: serialize_with_mode()] [Compression ambiguity] Can the same SRS serialize differently with Compress::Yes vs Compress::No, causing hash mismatches in content-addressed storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Coefficient sum invariant] The debug_assert checks sum equals ONE, but can numerical errors cause the sum to be 1 ± ε, breaking polynomial evaluation correctness in production? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Lagrange interpolation uniqueness] Does the function guarantee that the resulting basis uniquely represents degree-(n-1) polynomials, or can degenerate domains cause ambiguity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: powers_of_tau()] [Geometric series] Can tau being a root of unity (tau^k = 1 for some k < n) cause the powers sequence to repeat, creating a shorter effective SRS? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Parameter consistency] If caller provides mismatched (G, tau, n, eval_dom) where eval_dom was constructed with different parameters, can this silently produce invalid SRS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: powers_of_tau()] [Tau persistence] If tau is meant to be secret and destroyed after ceremony, can lingering references in memory allow recovery through memory dumps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Enum: SrsType] [Type-basis mismatch] Can code request SrsType::Lagrange but mistakenly construct SrsBasis::PowersOfTau, and is there any runtime check to detect this mismatch? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [IFFT implementation trust] Does the module verify that arkworks' IFFT implementation is correct, or can bugs in the library cause incorrect Lagrange coefficients to propagate? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: powers_of_tau()] [Batch mul security] Does batch_mul() implementation in arkworks have any known timing or security issues that could be exploited in SRS generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Trait: CanonicalSerialize] [Trait bound assumptions] Can malicious implementations of CurveGroup violate CanonicalSerialize/Deserialize contracts, bypassing validation in SrsBasis? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Tau leakage] If tau is not properly erased after SRS construction, can side-channel attacks (Spectre, Meltdown) recover it from CPU caches or speculative execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: powers_of_tau()] [Multi-party computation] Does the module support multi-party SRS generation where no single party knows tau, or does it require a trusted single party? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Ceremony verification] Can participants in a powers-of-tau ceremony verify that their contribution was correctly incorporated, or is there no auditability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Struct: SrsBasis] [Length mismatch] Can consumers of SrsBasis assume fixed vector lengths, and will dynamic lengths cause out-of-bounds access in commitment scheme implementations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Struct: SrsBasis] [Basis assumption] Do KZG commitment implementations correctly match their basis expectations (Lagrange for evaluation form, PowersOfTau for coefficient form), or can mismatches cause proof failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Enum: SrsBasis] [Pattern matching exhaustiveness] Can future additions of new SRS variants break existing match statements that assume only Lagrange/PowersOfTau, causing panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [FFT precision loss] For very large n (e.g., 2^20), can accumulated rounding errors in IFFT cause significant deviation from exact Lagrange coefficients? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: powers_of_tau()] [Exponentiation accuracy] Can fast exponentiation algorithms for computing tau^i introduce errors that compound across large i values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Non-deterministic FFT] If the arkworks IFFT implementation uses multi-threading with non-deterministic scheduling, can this cause different validators to compute different Lagrange bases? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: serialize_with_mode()] [Floating-point non-determinism] Can different CPU architectures (x86 vs ARM) produce slightly different serialized outputs due to floating-point rounding, breaking consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Struct: SrsBasis] [Proving key security] If SrsBasis is used as a proving key, can an attacker who controls SRS generation insert trapdoors enabling proof forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: lagrange_basis()] [Hiding property] Does the Lagrange SRS provide hiding (requires additional randomness), or can commitments using it leak polynomial coefficients? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/arkworks/srs.rs] [Function: powers_of_tau()] [Binding property] Can an attacker find two different polynomials that produce the same commitment using PowersOfTau SRS, breaking binding? (Critical)
